Fundamentals of Digital Signal Theory                     Time: 45 hours Credits: 3 credits Term: Fall/Spring Instructor: Agnieszka Roginska Theoretical and practical foundations for digital signal processing. Topics covered include signal representation in time and frequency domains, Fourier transform, spectrum analysis, transfer functions, convolution, filter theory and implementation. Lectures are reinforced with a co-requisite weekly lab using Matlab. Co-requisite: Digital Signal Theory I Lab. Fundamentals of Digital Signal Theory                     Time: 45 hours Credits: 3 credits Term: Fall/Spring Instructor: Agnieszka Roginska Theoretical and practical foundations for digital signal processing. Topics covered include signal representation in time and frequency domains, Fourier transform, spectrum analysis, transfer functions, convolution, filter theory and implementation. Advanced Digital Signal Theory                     Time: 45 hours Credits: 3 points Term: Spring Instructor: Tae Hong Park Prerequisite: MPATE-GE 2598 , MPATE-GE 2599 . Advanced training in standard digital signal processing techniques for audio and music processing. Topics include filters, delay lines, additive and subtractive synthesis and modulation techniques. The course is organized in seminar-style lectures, where the theory will be reviewed. These will be complemented with MATLAB-based assignments.    For more information, see the professor's course page . Fundamentals of Digital Signal Theory Lab                     Credits: 1 credit Term: Fall/Spring Instructor: Areti Andreopoulou, Andrew Madden Hands-on lab accompanying Fundamentals of Digital Signal Theory Lab E85.2599. Lab sessions will contain exercises and implementation in Matlab to reinforce topics including signal representation, Fourier transform, spectrum analysis, transfer functions, convolution, and filtering.
